Answer: The problem seems to be in the Explosion class. The animation stops after the first frame because the `animation.work()` method is not being called in the `animating()` method. You should call `animation.work()` in the `animating()` method to update the animation frame.

Here is the corrected `animating()` method in the Explosion class:

```java
public void animating() {
    if (!animation.playedOnce()) {
        animation.work();
    }
}
```

This will ensure that the animation continues to play until all frames have been displayed.

Also, ensure that the `animation.setDelay(10)` is set to a value that is appropriate for your game. The delay value determines the speed of the animation. A smaller value will make the animation play faster, and a larger value will make it play slower.

I hope this helps to resolve your issue. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
